turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Maserati 3200 GT.
turn.2: In total 2,689 manual GT models were produced.

turn.4: In 1999, an automatic transmission equipped model of the 3200 GT became available, either referred to as 3200 GT Automatica or 3200 GTA.
turn.6: Introduced at the March 1999 Geneva Motor Show, it was equipped with a 4-speed conventional torque converter automatic transmission supplied by Australian firm BTR.
turn.8: Engine output remained unchanged, though the engine was set up specifically for the automatic transmission; according to Maserati, the weight increase over the manual gearbox was limited to , for a total kerb weight.
turn.10: In Italy the Automatica commanded a 156.5−149.5 million Lire premium over the 3200 GT's 149.5 million Lire list price.
